oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Jim Glaser Interviewed by Bob Battle in 1978
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Battle interviewing Jim Glaser on the telephone. The recording takes place on 01-04-78.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Glaser
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:02) -- Phone Interview - Bob Battle from the Nashville Banner calls Jim Glaser. (0:46) -- Bob Battle asks about Jim Glaser's career and his plans for the future artistically. (1:14) -- Bob Battle asks about the productivity of Jim Glaser's publishing, songwriting, and singing. (1:54) -- Bob Battle asks about Jim Glaser's newest album. (2:44) -- Bob Battle asks Jim Glaser about working with Owen Bradley. (2:54) -- Bob Battle questions Jim Glaser about young talent he's been mentoring as of late. (3:28) -- Bob Battle questions Jim Glaser about his music publishing endeavors. (4:30) -- Bob Battle asks Jim Glaser the year he first came to Nashville. Jim Glaser has lived in Nashville since 1958. (4:50) -- Bob Battle asks Jim Glaser about "the greatest thing that's ever happened to you." (5:28) -- Bob Battle asks Jim Glaser about the first time he decided to become a solo recording and performing artist. Jim Glaser responds that it was a gradual process. (6:42) -- Bob Battle asks about Jim Glaser's strategies and goals when attempting to write a hit record. Owen Bradley told Jim Glaser that an artist needs three hit records to establish themselves in the music business. (7:49) -- Jim Glaser describes being dropped by Victor RCA. (8:46) -- Bob Battle asks about Jim Glaser's age and living situation. (8:57) -- Bob Battle asks Jim Glaser about the future of country music. (10:28) -- Bob Battle asks Jim Glaser about his future touring plans. (12:15) -- Bob Battle describes his "Country Cooking" column, asks Jim Glaser to send his personal recipes.
